path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Verichains_Lab/Verichains Public Audit Report - Goen Smartcontracts - v1.0.pdf

findings.title: Reentrancy in `withdrawAll` function if the rewardToken is WBNB
findings.description: The `withdrawAll` function uses the `call` method to transfer the native token and update the state variable after the transfer action, allowing attackers to use reentrancy attacks to gain profit multiple times in a transaction.

findings.title: Reentrancy in `harvest` function if the rewardToken is WBNB
findings.description: The `harvest` function uses the `_distributeReward` function implemented by the child contracts which triggers reentrancy, allowing attackers to swap tokens in the vault multiple times and get more harvestBounty. The reward factor may be affected.

findings.title: Attacker may spam `addUser` function to break the `harvest` and `reinvest` logics
findings.description: The `addUser` function is a public function with no limitation, allowing an attacker to spam it and increase the length of the `depositUsers` array, causing the for-loop in both `harvest` and `reinvest` functions to run out of gas.

findings.title: Attacker may spam `deposit` function to increase the length of `depositUsers` array
findings.description: The attacker can deposit 0 token (or approximate 0) to increase the length of `depositUsers` array, as there is no limitation with the `_amount` parameter in the `deposit` function.
